intro: Thoracosperma tenuis, commonly known as the slender mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is a small, evergreen tree or shrub that typically grows in brackish or saline wetlands. The plant has small, elliptical leaves that are usually covered in a fine, white powdery coating. Its flowers are small and clustered, with white or pale pink petals, and it produces woody, cylindrical fruits. The plant is adapted to coastal environments and plays an important role in stabilizing shorelines.
